author: alexnoel.co
post_text: May 23, 2018 at 11:46 PM#1I'd like to be able to store some user interaction into a variable, along the lines of "SetVar $cmd = @".It seems like the spaces that are coming from the "@" result are making that command invalid, so I need to essentially get the result of the @ command in quotations.Doing SetVar $cmd = "@" doesn't work, and the command line doesn't treat /"  @ /" as if it were escape characters. Is there a way around this?

posts.author: alexnoel.co
posts.post_text: May 23, 2018 at 11:46 PM#1I'd like to be able to store some user interaction into a variable, along the lines of "SetVar $cmd = @".It seems like the spaces that are coming from the "@" result are making that command invalid, so I need to essentially get the result of the @ command in quotations.Doing SetVar $cmd = "@" doesn't work, and the command line doesn't treat /"  @ /" as if it were escape characters. Is there a way around this?

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: May 24, 2018 at 12:35 AM#2It should be possible to do this with IntelliVars: (example assumes Presets)CodeSetVar $mypreset = "Preset "CD @$CAPTURECD /AddVar $mypreset = $C_NOread how to obtain and use IntelliVars here:http://www.ma-share.net/forum/read.php…61174#msg-61174

posts.author: alexnoel.co
posts.post_text: May 24, 2018 at 1:24 AM#3This is brilliant work, thank you!

posts.author: ram0003
posts.post_text: May 24, 2018 at 9:15 AM#4I've noticed that you can only select objects that only exist. Is it possible to create the object and select it in one @ command?

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: May 24, 2018 at 9:46 AM#5This could work:create the object with a known name at a known location.Cut, then paste object with  @Then change destination via known name, to capture infoe.g.CodeStore Group 999 "MyTempGroup"Cut Group 999Paste @CD Group "MyTempGroup"$captureCD /Setvar $GroupID=$C_NOLabel Group $GroupID "MyPermanentName"

title: Command line @ interaction with variables
